The claim was made by The Spectator Inde: a Twitter account with over 700,000 followers, which tweeted that Nigeria has 15 suicides per 100,000 people, per year, citing the World Health Organization (WHO) as its source.
The WHO data from 2016 shows that Nigeri: s suicide rate was 9.5 per 100,000 people, which is lower than the claimed rate of 15 per 100,000.
Historical data from the WHO: s Global Health Observatory shows that Nigeria has never recorded a suicide rate as high as 15 cases per 100,000 since 2000.
Some users questioned the claim and expr: with one user stating that Nigeria has a far lower suicide rate. However, the response from The Spectator Index or the source of their information was not obtained.
